alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that been producing the heavy rains have ended. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have fallen over this area from the earlier thunderstorms. This amount of water will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 345 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The Redland, Kendall, Richmond West, Country Walk, The Hammocks, The Crossings, Inlikita and Three Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
